intro: Pilosella bergidensis, commonly known as the Bergidens piloselle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its foliage is covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive, fluffy appearance. Pilosella bergidensis is often found in meadows and rocky slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
